page.title: 12THE ROAD NETWORK
page.content: Perhaps the{most striking feature}of {Telford}is the{large network of dual {carriageways and major roads}that have been built.They give{easy access}to the{M54}which gives a direct route to the{M6. The system is greatly needed in a new town and ensures a steady flow of goods moving in and out of Telford. {Easy access}is also given to the main {industrial estates}of{Halesfield, {Horton Wood}and{Stafford Park. Main roads through our area are{The {Queens Way}and{Dawley Green Way.}A traffic census on both roads showed that traffic is light and that the system has been built for the future. Lorries have been identified from as far apart as{Glasgow}and{Brighton . The network gives easy road access to {London 224Km Liverpool 99Km Manchester {112Km Felixstowe 301Km}and{Dover 363Km
